    Compare calibration and discovery results

    compare_calibration_and_discovery_results.Rd

    The compare_calibration_and_discovery_results() function compares two sets of p-values: the negative control p-values (i.e., those obtained from the calibration check) and the discovery p-values (i.e., those obtained from the discovery analysis). These two sets of p-values are plotted on the same Q-Q plot, with the negative control p-values colored in red and the discovery p-values colored in blue. The negative control p-values should lie along the diagonal line and fall mostly within the gray confidence band, indicating control of the false discovery rate. By contrast, the discovery p-values should lie above the diagonal line, indicating the presence of signal in the discovery set.

    compare_calibration_and_discovery_results(
  calibration_result,
  discovery_result,
  alpha = 0.1,
  multiple_testing_correction = "BH"
)

    Arguments

    calibration_result

    (required) the output of a call to run_sceptre_lowmoi with calibration_check set to TRUE

    discovery_result

    (required) the output of a call to run_sceptre_lowmoi with calibration_check set to FALSE

    alpha

    (optional; default 0.1) the nominal type-I error control level

    multiple_testing_correction

    (optional; default "BH") the multiple testing correction method (one of "BH", "bonferroni", "BY", or "holm")

    Value

    A ggplot2 object containing the Q-Q plot.

    Details

    The horizontal dashed line indicates the multiple testing threshold. Blue points above the horizontal dashed line are called as discoveries.

    Examples

    # See the example in the run_sceptre_lowmoi help file.
?run_sceptre_lowmoi
